title.narrative: 6.17 CROSS SECTORAL

description.narrative: Cross-sectoral, which contributes to Evaluation And Research, Evaluation And Research (Covid), Operations Support To Programme Delivery. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: EAPR effectively leverages and utilises resources, strategic partnerships, innovations, data and evidence to drive results for children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Cross-sectoral

description.narrative: In 2021, EAPR evaluation function continued to support evidence-based programmatic and policy decision-making. EAPR effectively implemented the revised Evaluation Policy and Regional Evaluation Strategy Action Plan. As a result, EAPR delivered 16 (including three regional) evaluations. ;All MCES posts continue to be filled.; Guidance has been provided to familiarize new MCES with UNICEF rules and regulations, based on which they are expanding their scope of support to country offices, for instance to KM areas. In 2021, EAPRO (@90%) and ROSA (@92%) where the only regions with an expenditure on evaluations of greater than 80%.; KPI for quality was met. | Status:Met | As-of Date:14/03/2022
